org.parboiled
Interface ContextAware<V>

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseActions, BaseParser, EventBusParser, JoinParser
public interface ContextAware<V>

Interface that can be implemented by classes containing action methods.

If a class implementing this interface is used in a parser, the generated parser will use this interface to inform the instance of the current context. This applies to Actions but also to parsers within parsers.

Note that implementing this interface currently will not prevent you from suffering the limits of actions; that is, if you are not the second or more member of a SequenceMatcher, you won't get a context (it will be null in this case).

See Also:
GroupClassGenerator.insertSetContextCalls(InstructionGroup, int)

Method Summary
 void setContext(Context<V> context)
          Called immediately before any parser action method invocation.
 

Method Detail

setContext

void setContext(Context<V> context)
Called immediately before any parser action method invocation. Informs the object containing the action about the context to be used for the coming action call.

Parameters:
context - the context
